node.statement: Iwasawa Unfolding and Gauss Sum Extraction: Using Iwasawa decomposition g = nak on GL_n(F), the integral unfolds to a sum over the torus A_n. The additive twist psi^{-1}(Q a_n k_{nn}) from Node 1.1, combined with K_1(q)-invariance of V^circ, produces a K-integral that is a generalized Gauss sum. Conductor-level analysis shows: (a) when val(Q varpi^{m_n}) > 0, the twist is trivial and the K-integral vanishes by orthogonality for ramified pi; (b) when val(Q varpi^{m_n}) < -c(pi), oscillation is too rapid and the K-integral vanishes by cancellation; (c) when val(Q varpi^{m_n}) = -c(pi), the conductors match and the K-integral equals a nonzero Gauss sum. Only case (c) contributes, so the torus sum collapses to a single coset, yielding a monomial.
